properties.name: El Porvenir
properties.description: UH1 is a 1.5" domed brass disk set in gray epoxy in the concrete deck of the jetty. It is 12" Northeast of the tide pole.

properties.name: El Porvenir
properties.description: UH2 is a 1.5" domed brass disk set in gray epoxy in the concrete deck of the jetty. It is located at the Northeast corner of the jetty on the shore. It is just above the cement anchor block for the jetty ramp. It is 7" West of the short lamp post on the North side of the jetty.

properties.name: El Porvenir
properties.description: UH3 is a 1.5" domed brass disk set in gray epoxy. It is located on the West corner of the top step of the concrete block base of the flag pole in front of the imigration/police office.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: 1"dia.  Brass Disc epoxied into concrete near the base of the tide station.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: 1" dia. Brass Disc epoxied into the sea plane ramp. If standing on the sea plane ramp looking down towards the water it will be on your right hand side near the curb. At high tide this BM will be under water.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: This is a 1/2" SS hexhead bolt set into the concrete pad on the SW corner of the maintenance bay. It is the corner of the maintenance bay that is closest to the tide gauge. The mark is near to the SW post of the bay but not covered.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: This is the tip of a SS wedge anchor sticking up from the SW edge of the concrete foundation near to the dry lab. This mark is closer to the section of plants that separate the dry lab from the main road leading to the maintenance bay.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: This is the tip of a SS wedge anchor sticking up from the NE edge of the concrete foundation around an electrical utility box sunk into the ground. The mark is located just outside of the NW corner of the main generator building. The electrical box and the BM are visible from the main road.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: This is the tip of a SS wedge anchor sticking up from the edge of the concrete foundation around an electrical utility box sunk into the ground. The electrical box and the BM are visible from the main road as you walk from the generator to the toilets.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: This is the tip of a SS wedge anchor sticking up from the edge of the concrete foundation block under the SW corner of the Breezeway shipping container closest to the road.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: This is the tip of a SS wedge anchor sticking up from the edge of the concrete foundation around an electrical utility box sunk into the ground on the North Beach side of the road as you walk from the bathrooms to the airport. The electrical box and the BM should be visible from the main road. If they are not, some tree trimming may be necessary.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: This is the tip of a SS wedge anchor sticking up from the edge of the concrete foundation around an electrical utility box sunk into the ground on the North Beach side of the road as you walk from UHTG 8 to the airport. The electrical box and the BM should be visible from the main road. If they are not, some tree trimming may be necessary.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: This is the tip of a SS wedge anchor that is set into the top of a black coral boulder on the East side of the path over the culvert and onto the runway. The boulder is on the North side of the culvert closer to UHTG 9.

properties.name: Palmyra Island
properties.description: This is a “bottle cap" shaped pin set into a small (12") concrete pad at ground level. It is about 5m West of the old abandoned airplane at end of runway.

properties.name: Ala Wai Hbr (Oahu Hawaii)
properties.description: Local NGS Benchmark (PID is TU1256) details.

properties.name: Ala Wai Hbr (Oahu Hawaii)
properties.description: ALA_WAI_PBM is 1.5" brass BM epoxied into concrete curb ~20m south of enterence to G Dock

properties.name: Ala Wai Hbr (Oahu Hawaii)
properties.description: Harbor Master Office is 1.5" brass BM epoxied into concrete in the North East corner of the building near the fire extinguisher and rear gate

properties.name: Lembar
properties.description: 4" diameter brass disk set in a 1 foot square concrete block about 50 meters East of the tide gauge. SEE PHOTOS.

properties.name: Lembar
properties.description: 1.5" brass dome set in concrete ledge just above the fiberglass I beam used for the SW and PRS mount.

properties.name: Lembar
properties.description: 4" diameter brass disk set in a 1 foot square concrete block that is in front of the Navigation Office. This BM is in a cement block about 1 foot cube on a cement foundataion in a piece of land Northeast of the intersection at the North end of the main road heading North away from the tide gauge. SEE PHOTOS.

properties.name: Lembar
properties.description: 4" diameter brass disk set in a 1 foot square concrete block and 1 meter square concrete wing that is in Mosque courtyad. This mosque named "Nurul Bahari" which is on the side of the road that leads to the cement terminal.

properties.name: Kanton
properties.description: Building is to the south west of tidestation and is only a frame now.  All the building's walls have fallen down almost covering the BM.

properties.name: Kanton
properties.description: Additional description: Recovered West of station.

properties.name: Kanton
properties.description: A large motor remains bolted to the foundation.  UH3 located 4 paces from the tide station.

properties.name: Saipan
properties.description: SW corner of DELTA Dock, 3' North of fence line. Below "MOBIL" sign.

properties.name: Saipan
properties.description: SS Hex Bolt Head set in cement walkway 1' North of center flagpole at north entrance to Seaport Admin building.

properties.name: Saipan
properties.description: 1" SS Square set in cement dock SE corner of CHARLIE Dock.  1' from southmost rubber bumper fixed to dock wall.

properties.name: Saipan
properties.description: USGS-type Stamped Brass Disk set in cement at NW corner of ABLE Dock] 1' East of corner cleat. (May be covered with sand).

properties.name: Saipan
properties.description: USGS-type Stamped Brass Disk set in cement at SW end of ABLE Dock on raised curb NW of fence.

properties.name: Saipan
properties.description: 1 3/8" brass domed marker set in the concrete edge of the pier wall about 2' left of the 2024 tide gauge mast base

properties.name: Saipan
properties.description: USGS type stamped BM "ITDC" Located next to curb in parking lot near enterence of DLNR Lands and Survey dept. See Photos.

properties.name: Saipan
properties.description: Bottom flat plain of Zeypher Geodetic II GPS Antenna. Can not be surveyed directly. Value calculated as shown in scan from back of 07-2023 trip leveling book.

properties.name: Ofu
properties.description: ~4" Brass Corps of Engineers US Army Stamped "OFU 01" on concrete next to tide gauge.

properties.name: Ofu
properties.description: ~4" Brass Corps of Engineers US Army Stamped "OFU 02" on raised concrete pillar supporting red pipe, opposet side of dock as tide gauge. See Photos.

properties.name: Ofu
properties.description: ~1" Steel Pin epoxied into large concrete block on opposet side (south) of pier. Set is a washer stamped "ASTCA Blast Project" Likely to be moved eventually.

properties.name: Ofu
properties.description: ~4" Brass Corps of Engineers US Army Stamped "OFU 03" epoxied into concrete pad for the abandoned weather station near the engineered sea wall, may be in bushes. See Photos

properties.name: Ofu
properties.description: ~2" Brass BM Stamped "OFU 101 BLAST", epoxied into the concrete of the engineered sea was, Southern end, near the red light tower.

properties.name: Ofu
properties.description: ~2" brass BM stamped "TOM 1996" epoxied into concrete engineered sea wall at the Northern end of the of the flat concrete

properties.name: Tau
properties.description: ~4" Brass Corps of Engineers US Army Stamped "UAS 03" epoxied into ground level concrete slab ocean side of nearest covered building to tide gauge. See Photos.

properties.name: Tau
properties.description: ~4" Brass Corps of Engineers US Army Stamped "TAU 01" epoxied into stand alone concrete pillar in field between tide gauge and sea wall. See Photos.

properties.name: Tau
properties.description: ~4" Brass Corps of Engineers US Army Unstamped. Epoxied into inside corner concrete as coast road turns in towards the tide gauge, ocean side. See Photos.

properties.name: Tau
properties.description: ~4" Brass US Geological Survey stamped "TIDE GAUGE" and "ET". It is on a rocky cliff near the warehouse across the grass from the pier. See Photos.

properties.name: Tau
properties.description: ~4" Brass Corps of Engineers US Army Stamped "TAU 01" epoxied into stand alone concrete pillar on side of road shortly after the road splits, mountain side of road. See Photos.

properties.name: Tau
properties.description: ~4" Brass US Geological Survey stamped "ET". It is on a rocky shoreline a couple hundred meters down from the pier. Shorline access is across split in road leading to TAU 02. It will be under water at high tide.See Photos.

properties.name: Malakal
properties.description: THIS MARK IS 80 PACES FROM UH3A BEARING 120 DEGREES UP A SMALL RISE TOWARDS A SEWAGE SETTLING BASIN AREA. THE MARK IS ABOUT 3 FEET ABOVE A CEMENT CULVERT RUNNING BETWEEN THE SEWAGE SETTLING AREA AND THE MOUNTAIN. THE MARK IS A 1” ROUNDED BRASS DISK SET IN A BOULDER AT THE MOUNTAIN BASE. THE BOULDER IS PARTIALLY COVERED BY THE CONCRETE CULVERT AT THE WEST END OF THE CULVERT.

properties.name: Malakal
properties.description: LD IS ~2” ROUND DISK STAMPED "LAMONT – DOHERTY GEOLOGICAL OBSERVATORY EARTHQUAKE RESEARCH BMDC  MCMXCII".  IT IS ~35 METERS SE OF THE GPS ANTENNA ON THE PIER DECK LESS THEN 2’ FROM THE WATER.

properties.name: Malakal
properties.description: Round, domed brass BM pin. Unmarked. Set on top of sea wall ~ 35m from the concrete stairs walking away from the clam farm

properties.name: Malakal
properties.description: Round, domed brass BM pin. Unmarked. Set on top of sea wall ~ 100m from the concrete stairs walking away from the clam farm

properties.name: Vung Tau
properties.description: Is the bench mark adjacent to the tide house on the pier.  The mark is a raised half dome of brass in the center of the concrete platform about ½ m square and 5 cm tall.  The platform is marked VT1  8_2006 and is about 2 meters South of the tide house.

properties.name: Vung Tau
properties.description: A 2" diameter bronze disk set in the concrete base of the I-beam in the SW corner of the double decker parking lot. It is North of the main path into the harbor area where the tide gauge is.

properties.name: Vung Tau
properties.description: A 2" diameter bronze disk set in the concrete curb of a landscape planter with grass and palm trees. It is on the SE side of the hrbor property along the main road. It is across the street from the Coast Guard Hotel

properties.name: Bitung
properties.description: Located in front of Pelindo office at the right corner.

properties.name: Bitung
properties.description: Located near the tide house above I beam/switches (brass)

properties.name: Bitung
properties.description: Located next to warehouse set on the concre of gate (brass)

properties.name: Bitung
properties.description: Replaces BM3, see location above. It is an upside-down 1/4" SS anchor bolt epoxied into top of concrete wall at corner of container yard.

properties.name: Bitung
properties.description: Located at the other corner of container yard from BM3A. Upside-down 1/4"anchor bolt epoxied into top of concrete wall. Across the street from BM BAKO

properties.name: Quepos
properties.description: ~4" brass BM set in the cement just on the land-side of the threshhold between land and jetty. Established by National Geographic Institute. See BM Photos.

properties.name: Quepos
properties.description: ~4" brass BM set in the cement foundation of the Police station down the road from the jetty. Established by National Geographic Institute. See BM Photos.

properties.name: Pt.LaRue
properties.description: A SECTION OF 1/2" STAINLESS ROD MOUNTED IN WHITE EPOXY ON THE NORTH BREAKWATER WALL WEST OF THE TIDE GAUGE. IT ON THE RUNWAY SIDE OF THE COLLAPSED OLD BOAT DOCK AREA

properties.name: Pt.LaRue
properties.description: A SECTION OF 1/2" STAINLESS ROD MOUNTED IN WHITE EPOXY ON THE NORTH BREAKWATER WALL & ABOUT 100 M EAST OF THE START OF THE JETTY ACCESS ROAD ON THE CURVED LOOKOUT

properties.name: Pt.LaRue
properties.description: A SECTION OF 1/2" STAINLESS ROD MOUNTED IN WHITE EPOXY ON THE SOUTH BREAKWATER WALL OF THE JETTY ACCESS ROAD AT THE OUTCROP ABOUT ABOUT MIDWAY TO THE JETTY.

properties.name: Pt.LaRue
properties.description: THIS BM IS A REFERENCE PIN FOR THE DORRIS STATION. IT IS LOCATED ON  A CONCRETE SLAB ON THE GROUND TO THE NORTH OF THE DORRIS MONUMENT. THE PIN IS A SMALL BRASS SCREW HEAD ON THE CORNER OF THE PAD.

properties.name: Pt.LaRue
properties.description: THIS IS AN OLD GPS MONUMENT ON A THICK SLAB. THERE ARE 4 PINS, ONE IN EACH CORNER AND A FITH PIN IN THE MIDDLE OF THE SLAB DIRECTLY WITHIN THE TRIANGULAR GPS MONUMENT. WE ARE USING THE MIDDLE PIN. THE LEVELING ROD NEEDS TO BE PLACED WITHIN THE SMALL BASE TOWER.

properties.name: Pt.LaRue
properties.description: 1” DIAMETER BRASS DOMED PIN SET IN CONCRETE ON THE WEST EDGE OF THE NEW TIDE HOUSE STEPS. INSTALLED August 10, 2006.

properties.name: Pt.LaRue
properties.description: A STAINLESS 1 INCH X 1 INCH PLATE MOUNTED IN WHITE EPOXY MOUNTED AT THE SW CORNER OF THE T.G. CONCRETE SLAB AND ABOUT 15 FT SOUTH OF BMUH1.

properties.name: Qui Nhon
properties.description: This mark is a porcelain dome abut 4 cm diameter with fine writing around the edges. It is in the center of a concrete pad about 30 cm square below grade in a small concrete "bunker" under a rectangular concrete cover about m square and 5 cm thick located on the SE side of the tide house. The concrete pad is incised with TC-KTTV, HV-III, 6-1992. See sketch map for better understanding of location relative to tide house.

properties.name: Qui Nhon
properties.description: This mark is a black glass (?) domed rectangle and 2cm x 4 cm. It is in the center of a concrete pad about 25 cm square below grade in a small concrete "bunker" under a square concrete cover about m square and 5 cm thick with 2 curved re bar handles located on the SE side of the tide house. The concrete pad is incised with KTTV, 20.5.9?. See sketch map for better understanding of location relative to tide house.

properties.name: Qui Nhon
properties.description: This mark is a porcelain dome abut 4 cm diameter with fine writing around the edges. It is in the center of a concrete pad about 30 cm square level with the ground located on the rocks on the NW side of the tide house. The concrete pad is incised with TC-KTTV, HV III, 6-198?.  Covering the mark and the pad is a rectangular concrete lid with a concave center sitting loosely over the pad and mark.  See sketch map for better understanding of location relative to tide house.

properties.name: Qui Nhon
properties.description: Bronze dome set into the granite shoreline. The position is on the bottom level where the SWs are, along the shoreline moving away from the tide house. It is directly on the water side of the platform holding the water tanks. This BM is not under the platform of the water tanks. I positioned this BM to be able to be used to connect the SWs and QN UH2.  Photos are in the file as well as Coordinates.

properties.name: Qui Nhon
properties.description: This is the tip of a 1/4" SS wedge anchor that is set into the cement railing that runs along the walkway from the stilling well towards the  BM KTTV.  I positioned this BM to make shooting the 3 radar sensor easier. Photos and cordinates are in the notes.

properties.name: Limon
properties.description: 1 3/8" rounded brass mark on the concrete pier deck near the Aquatrak well next to Ml

properties.name: Limon
properties.description: 1" dia rounded bolt head on the lower inside ledge of the sea wall surrounding the port. About 1m above the deck. See photos and map.

properties.name: Limon
properties.description: 1" dia rounded bolt head on the concrete barrier wall surrounding a light pole. About 1m above the deck. See photos and map.

properties.name: Limon
properties.description: 1" dia rounded bolt head on the concrete floor near a light pole. See photos and map.

properties.name: Limon
properties.description: 1" dia rounded bolt head on the concrete barrier wall surrounding a light pole. About 1m above the deck. See photos and map.

properties.name: Limon
properties.description: 1" dia rounded bolt head on the concrete floor near a light pole. See photos and map.

properties.name: Auasi
properties.description: ~4" Brass Corps of Engineers US ARMY BM Stamped UAS01. Epoxied into concrete platform with Tsunami Siren, ocean side of pavillion , above tide gauge. See Photo.

properties.name: Auasi
properties.description: ~4" National Geodetic Survey BM Stamped ASO4. Located 5' in front of Tide Gauge enclosure on upper level of tide gauge concrete platform. See Photo.

properties.name: Auasi
properties.description: ~1.5" Domed Brass BM epoxied into inside corner curb of the parking lot for the boat harbor/restrooms. It’s the corner of the parking lot nearest the tide gauge boat ramp.

properties.name: Auasi
properties.description: ~4" Brass Corps of Engineers US ARMY BM Stamped AUA01. Epoxied into base of the Auasi Boat Harbor sign, and the red fire hydrant. See Photo.

properties.name: Auasi
properties.description: ~4" Brass Corps of Engineers US ARMY BM Stamped UAS02. Epoxied into top of sea wall at the inlet on the opposet side of the harbor as the tide gauge. Land is private property. We asked for permission before entering. See Photo.

properties.name: Aunuu
properties.description: ~2" Silver BM Stamped L.P. FRENCH RPS20. It is set in a concrete atop the rock seawall. See Photos.

properties.name: Aunuu
properties.description: ~4" Brass BM Stamped Corps of Engineers US ARMY AUN1. It is on the pier itself aprox 10' to the right of the tide gauge.

properties.name: Aunuu
properties.description: ~4" Brass BM Stamped Corps of Engineers US Army AUN01. It is on the curb on the side of the road near the volleyball court. See Photos.

properties.name: Aunuu
properties.description: ~4" Brass BM Stamped Coprs of Engineers US ARMY AUN02. It is installed on a very large concerete pad at the end of a short concrete wall. See Photos.

properties.name: Aunuu
properties.description: ~4" Brass BM Stamped Corps of Engineers US ARMY AUN3. The "3" is stamped upside down. It is at the end of a long narrow concrete pad in a grass yard. See Photos.
